summary:
I am a dedicated advocate for human rights and justice, driven by a deep passion to make a difference in the lives of individuals. Throughout my journey, I have consistently sought to expand my knowledge and understanding of legal matters in order to contribute to the pursuit of justice.

For over four years, I actively engaged with NGOs, immersing myself in the complexities of discrimination and injustice prevalent in our society. My educational background reflects my unwavering dedication to the field of law. I completed a four-year study in civil law, followed by three years specializing in international law. This academic foundation has provided me with a comprehensive understanding of legal principles and their application in diverse contexts.

Moreover, my professional experience spans over five years, encompassing various legal domains. I have worked extensively in areas such as international law, human rights law, family law, criminal law, environmental law, estate law, and immigration law, both in Iran and Canada. These experiences have allowed me to tackle a wide range of legal issues and provided me with invaluable insights into the complexities of legal systems.

As a lifelong learner and passionate legal professional, I am eager to explore new avenues within the legal field. I am particularly interested in collaborating on projects that involve legal matters, as I am genuinely enthusiastic about leveraging my legal expertise to make a positive impact on people's lives.
